p: The acute oral toxicity test was carried out using female Wistar rats. The number of animals and sex used for each test were determined considering both Organization of Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) guidelines and the opinion of the Ethics Review Committee of Medical Research Institute (2016/22), Sri Lanka, based on the 3R concept. All animals were maintained under standard laboratory conditions including 20°C to 24°C temperature, 50% to 70% relative humidity, and a light regimen of 12 h light and dark throughout the experimental period. Standard size, polycarbonate, and transparent cages were used for animal housing. Three rats from the same sex were kept in one cage. Sterilized wood shavings were used as the bedding material. All animals were fed with MRI rabbit and rat formula prepared according to WHO guideline given by Saboudry [ 22]. The formulations were prepared at the Medical Research Institute using locally available ingredients. All rats were acclimatized to laboratory conditions for a period of 7 days prior to dosing.
